content.en:
POSITIONS FILLED

WEB FRONT-END developer

Médialab's Research and Development team seeks a WEB FRONT-END developer to contribute to different research projects (more specifically on Inquiry into modes of existence and Source project).

You will join an academic Research and Development team to collaborate to motivating Social sciences and Humanities projects in an innovative and transdisciplinarity spirit between Information Technology, Social Sciences and information and interaction design. Your code will be visible by the many users of our platforms and published and shared with the Open Source community. English speakers are welcomed to apply if they will to learn some french while working in Paris.

Review the complete job description and apply through this form.
Position to be opened in March 2015 (in process of validation)

Research Fellow in Quantitative Analysis

Politics of the Earth is a new research programme that will be launched in January 2015 by Sorbonne Paris Cité (SPC), a consortium of higher education institutions. The programme gathers 20+ research laboratories, originating from five different institutions: Sciences Po (coordinator), University Paris Descartes, University Paris Diderot, University Paris 13, and the Institute for Globe Physics (IPGP). This interdisciplinary programme lies at the interface of social, natural and Earth sciences, as it seeks to apprehend the new research challenges brought upon by the Anthropocene, a new epoch where humans are the key driving forces of changes on the planet. In particular, the programme is centred on the representations and government of these new challenges and data. It is coordinated by Bruno Latour, Professor at Sciences Po, and is organised in three research clusters: Geopolitics of Carbon Dioxides; Expertise of Risks and Mediatisation of Disasters; Dynamics of Critical Zones and Urbanisation Conflicts. Politics of the Earth is seeking outstanding candidates to assist with the development of the programme for the following position: - Research fellow in Quantitative Analysis Job description : Research Fellow in Quantitative Analysis Interested candidates should send a CV and cover letter by December 19, 2014, indicating the names of two referees who can be contacted upon request. Applications should be sent by email to: Francois.Gemenne@sciencespo.fr and copied to: Bruno.Latour@sciencespo.fr The positions is to be filled rapidly.
content.fr:
EMPLOIS POURVUS

Développeur(se) d’interfaces WEB

L'équipe de Recherche et Développement du médialab recrute un(e) développeur(se) d’interfaces WEB pour mener à bien ses projets de recherche (notamment Enquêtes sur les modes d’existence et le projet Source) . Vous rejoindrez l'équipe de Recherche et Développement du médialab où vous participerez à des projets de recherche motivants en Sciences Humaines et Sociales dans un esprit d’innovation et de transdisciplinarité entre technologie, sciences humaines et design de l’information et de l’interaction. Vos réalisations seront Open Source et un effort particulier sera apporté à leur visibilité tant auprès de nombreux utilisateurs que vers la communauté Open Source. Lisez la description complète et postuler en remplissant ce formulaire.
Poste à pourvoir à partir de Mars 2015 (en cours de validation).

WEB FRONT-END developer

Politics of the Earth is a new research programme that will be launched in January 2015 by Sorbonne Paris Cité (SPC), a consortium of higher education institutions. The programme gathers 20+ research laboratories, originating from five different institutions: Sciences Po (coordinator), University Paris Descartes, University Paris Diderot, University Paris 13, and the Institute for Globe Physics (IPGP). In particular, the programme is centred on the representations and government of these new challenges and data. It is coordinated by Bruno Latour, Professor at Sciences Po, and is organised in three research clusters: Geopolitics of Carbon Dioxides; Expertise of Risks and Mediatisation of Disasters; Dynamics of Critical Zones and Urbanisation Conflicts. Politics of the Earth is seeking outstanding candidates to assist with the development of the programme for the following position: - Research fellow in Quantitative Analysis Job description : Research Fellow in Quantitative Analysis Interested candidates should send a CV and cover letter, indicating the names of two referees who can be contacted upon request. Applications should be sent by email to: Francois.Gemenne@sciencespo.fr and copied to: Bruno.Latour@sciencespo.fr The positions are to be filled rapidly.
